quest1.title: The Alchemist’s Trial of Color
quest1.rationale:
The Alchemist’s Trial of Color

Why it’s important:
This quest establishes technical literacy in acrylic painting. Before expression or subject matter can succeed, the artist must understand how paint behaves.

Skills developed:

  • Fundamental brush control
  • Understanding paint application techniques (dry brush, washes, layering, scumbling, glazing, etc.)
  • Intentional mark-making
  • Awareness of paint thickness, opacity, and texture

This acts as the mechanical foundation for all later painting quests.
quest1.description:
Within the Hall of Canvases, the elders demand proof of your versatility.
You must create a single painted sample that demonstrates your command of at least ten distinct acrylic techniques.
Each technique represents a trial—layering like stacked enchantments, dry brushing as light as a rogue’s step, washes flowing like elemental magic, and more of your choosing.
requirements: Use one Page to unite all techniques
Demonstrate no fewer than 10 different acrylic painting techniques
Each technique must be clearly visible and intentional

levels.4: Mastery of 12+ techniques with exceptional control and creativity.
levels.3: Clear demonstration of 10–11 distinct techniques as required.
levels.2: 8–9 techniques shown; some unclear or poorly executed.
levels.1: 7 or fewer techniques; minimal technical understanding.

levels.4: Highly refined composition with intentional choices throughout.
levels.3: Mostly refined with minor inconsistencies.
levels.2: Some refinement; several unresolved areas.
levels.1: Little evidence of refinement.

quest2.title: Echoes of the Masters
quest2.rationale:
Echoes of the Masters

Why it’s important:
Copying masterworks trains your eye to recognize successful visual solutions. This quest teaches you to read a painting like a language and understand how style, composition, and technique work together.

Skills developed:

  • Observation and visual analysis
  • Accurate replication of composition and form
  • Understanding of color harmony and brushwork
  • Building technical confidence through repetition

This prepares you to apply these principles creatively in your own work.
quest2.description:
The Council of Scholars has issued a formidable challenge.
Deep within the archives lie masterpieces forged by artists of great movements: Impressionism, Cubism, Surrealism, and beyond.
You must choose one famed painting from any artistic movement and faithfully replicate it, studying its style, technique, and visual language. Through this trial, you will learn the secrets the Masters once wielded.
requirements: Select one famous painting from a recognized artistic movement
Replicate the artwork’s composition, style, and technique as closely as possible.

levels.4: Deep research evident; clear connection between analysis and execution.
levels.3: Good research; clear attempt to understand and apply master's style.
levels.2: Basic research; vague connection to original artwork.
levels.1: Minimal research; no clear understanding of source material.

levels.4: Masterful analysis and reproduction of style, composition, and technique.
levels.3: Accurate replication of key elements; clear understanding of style.
levels.2: Partial replication; some elements misunderstood or incorrect.
levels.1: Poor replication; major deviations from original style/form.

levels.4: Composition expertly matches original; thoughtful planning evident.
levels.3: Composition closely matches original; logical organization.
levels.2: Composition somewhat matches; organization inconsistent.
levels.1: Composition poorly matches; disorganized approach.

quest3.title: The Grand Codex of Art Movements
quest3.rationale:
The Grand Codex of Art Movements

Why it’s important:
This quest builds art literacy and helps you understand how visual styles evolve. Knowing the history and visual language of art movements allows you to make more informed creative choices.

Skills developed:

  • Research and visual interpretation
  • Translating theory into imagery
  • Stylistic flexibility
  • Designing clear visual information (poster composition)

It strengthens both your critical thinking and your artistic vocabulary.
quest3.description:
The Archivist seeks a visual codex to preserve the knowledge of art across the ages. You have been chosen to create a powerful poster that brings together four different artistic movements; each recorded as its own illuminated entry.
For every movement, you must gather and display its essential lore: the story of its origins, the names of its most influential artists, the defining characteristics that set it apart, and a hand-drawn illustration that captures its `spirit`.
requirements: For each of the four artistic movements, your poster must include:
A clear description of the movement.
The names of important artists.
Key characteristics.
A drawing or illustration that represents the movement's style (any media).

rubric.overall: The Grand Codex of Art Movements

levels.4: Extensive, well-documented research; clear connections between information and visuals.
levels.3: Good research; information clearly presented with visual support.
levels.2: Basic research; information incomplete or vaguely connected to visuals.
levels.1: Minimal research; information sparse or inaccurate.

levels.4: Masterful understanding of movements; illustrations perfectly capture each style's essence.
levels.3: Clear understanding; illustrations represent movements accurately.
levels.2: Partial understanding; illustrations somewhat represent movements.
levels.1: Poor understanding; illustrations don't represent movements.

levels.4: Exceptional design; information hierarchy clear, layout visually compelling.
levels.3: Well-designed; information organized, layout logical and clear.
levels.2: Design adequate; some organizational issues or visual confusion.
levels.1: Poor design; disorganized, difficult to read/understand.

quest4.title: Trial of the Masters (Summative)
quest4.rationale:
Trial of the Masters (Summative)

Why it’s important:
This quest marks the transition from imitation to creative mastery. You must interpret a movement’s visual language rather than copy it, which builds artistic independence.

Skills developed:

  • Creative interpretation and abstraction
  • Applying stylistic elements intentionally
  • Concept development and visual storytelling
  • Advanced composition and color use

This is a summative challenge proving mastery of art concepts.
quest4.description:
The Dark Lord captured the Old Modern Masters and want to reshape visual art to its liking. With your newly acquired skills you are tasked to choose one major art movement and uncover its core visual language.
Through research and experimentation, you will learn the movement’s key ideas: how it uses color, form, space, emotion, or abstraction. Then, wield acrylic paint to create an original artwork that reflects those ideas — not a copy, but a creative interpretation worthy of a Master.
requirements: Select one major art movement
Study its key visual ideas and characteristics
Create an original acrylic painting inspired by the movement
Show clear connections between your artwork and the chosen movement

levels.4: Highly original interpretation; creative synthesis of movement's ideas.
levels.3: Clear, original interpretation; good connection to movement.
levels.2: Derivative interpretation; weak creative connection.
levels.1: Copy-like interpretation; no creative input.

levels.4: Expert composition; masterful use of color, form, space as per movement.
levels.3: Strong composition; clear application of movement's visual ideas.
levels.2: Basic composition; partial application of movement's ideas.
levels.1: Poor composition; no clear application of movement's ideas.

levels.4: Deep research evident; sophisticated connection between theory and artwork.
levels.3: Good research; clear connections between movement and artwork.
levels.2: Basic research; vague connections between movement and artwork.
levels.1: Minimal research; no clear connections demonstrated.

levels.4: Masterful understanding and application of movement's visual language.
levels.3: Clear understanding and application of movement's characteristics.
levels.2: Partial understanding; some characteristics applied incorrectly.
levels.1: Poor understanding; movement's characteristics not applied.

levels.4: Exceptional dedication; thorough process from research to final piece.
levels.3: Good effort; complete process from research to final piece.
levels.2: Inconsistent effort; process incomplete or rushed.
levels.1: Minimal effort; process largely incomplete.

quest5.title: The Geomancer’s Trial
quest5.rationale:
The Geomancer’s Trial

Why it’s important:
Simple shapes force you to focus on value and form without distractions. This is the foundation of realistic painting because it trains your eye to see light and shadow clearly.

Skills developed:

  • Value control (light, midtone, dark)
  • Shading and blending
  • Understanding 3D form
  • Composition through shape placement

Mastering this makes all later subject matter easier.
quest5.description: The Order of Geomancers tests all aspiring artists in the fundamentals of visual magic. /nour task is to create a painting built from three different shapes, each carefully crafted to show mastery of value (light and dark)./nThrough deliberate shading, layering, and surface effects, you will give each shape its own presence and depth. Though simple in form, this trial demands close attention to contrast and tactile illusion.
requirements: Include three clearly different shapes
Focus on value using light, mid-tone, and dark areas
Paint all elements in a single cohesive composition.
Make sure that there’s a smooth transition of colours (blending)

levels.4: Masterful value control; flawless blending and shading techniques.
levels.3: Good value control; clear light, mid-tone, dark areas with blending.
levels.2: Basic value control; blending inconsistent or incomplete.
levels.1: Poor value control; minimal shading or blending.

levels.4: Exceptional attention to detail; perfectly smooth transitions and clean edges.
levels.3: Good craftsmanship; smooth transitions, careful execution.
levels.2: Adequate craftsmanship; some rough transitions or messy areas.
levels.1: Poor craftsmanship; transitions harsh, execution careless.

quest6.title: The Alchemist’s Smothness
quest6.rationale:
The Alchemist’s Smoothness

Why it’s important:
Blending is one of the most difficult skills in painting. This quest teaches control of pigment, timing, and brush pressure so you can create seamless gradients.

Skills developed:

  • Smooth transitions and gradients
  • Brush pressure control
  • Color mixing and harmony
  • Patience and precision

This skill is essential for skies, skin, soft lighting, and realistic textures.
quest6.description: The Chromatic Guild has summoned you to prove your skill in the mystical art of color blending. Your task is to mix, layer, and transition paints to create a cohesive color scheme, where each color merges smoothly into the next. Precision, patience, and control of pigment are your weapons in this trial.
requirements: Choose a range of colors to blend
Create smooth transitions between each color.
Present a finished work where the color progression is clear and harmonious
Remember that paint dries up faster on paper.

levels.4: Seamless blending with excellent control and consistent transitions.
levels.3: Smooth blending with minor inconsistencies.
levels.2: Blending attempted but transitions are uneven or patchy.
levels.1: Little evidence of blending technique or control.

levels.4: Highly refined composition with intentional choices throughout.
levels.3: Mostly refined with minor inconsistencies.
levels.2: Some refinement; several unresolved areas.
levels.1: Little evidence of refinement.

quest7.title: The Woody Grain’s Challenge
quest7.rationale:
The Woody Grain’s Challenge

Why it’s important:
Texture makes surfaces believable. Wood requires controlled irregularity, which trains your eye to observe subtle patterns and replicate them accurately.

Skills developed:

  • Textural linework and pattern
  • Controlled shading for depth
  • Surface variation and realism
  • Attention to detail

It strengthens your ability to depict natural materials and environments.
quest7.description: Wood is struggling with his patterns and needs help. To succeed, you must observe the subtle lines, knots, and grains that make each piece of wood unique, and translate them onto your page with precision and care. This trial will sharpen your skills in texture, line work, and shading as you bring wood to life with your pencil or pen.
requirements: Study a piece of wood or reference image carefully
Draw realistic wood textures, including grain, knots, and natural patterns
Use shading and line work to convey depth and surface quality
Produce a finished drawing that clearly represents wood

levels.4: Wood texture is highly realistic with controlled shading and detail.
levels.3: Clear wood texture with good shading and pattern.
levels.2: Texture shown but lacks realism or consistency.
levels.1: Minimal or inaccurate texture.

levels.4: Highly accurate interpretation of wood characteristics and surface quality.
levels.3: Accurate interpretation with minor errors.
levels.2: Partial understanding shown; some details misinterpreted.
levels.1: Poor interpretation of wood qualities.

quest8.title: Bob of the Silver Hall
quest8.rationale:
Bob of the Silver Hall

Why it’s important:
Metal surfaces teach you how light behaves on reflective materials. This quest trains your ability to create high contrast, sharp edges, and accurate highlights.

Skills developed:

  • High contrast value control
  • Sharp vs. soft edge handling
  • Reflective logic and highlight placement
  • Precision rendering

This skill is essential for realism and for making objects appear tangible.
quest8.description: The robot Bob of the Silver Hall have summoned you to master the craft of metallic illustration. Your task is to observe how light dances across metal surfaces—gleaming, reflecting, and bending around edges—and render it on your page with careful shading and precision. Through this trial, you will gain the power to make even the coldest metal appear lifelike.
requirements: Study a piece of metal or reference image carefully
Paint realistic metal surfaces, including reflections, highlights, and shadows
Use shading and contrast to convey depth, form, and reflective qualities
Produce a finished drawing that convincingly represents metal

levels.4: Metal surface appears highly realistic with excellent highlight control.
levels.3: Metal surface is realistic with good contrast and reflection.
levels.2: Some metallic qualities shown, but reflections or contrast are weak.
levels.1: Minimal metallic rendering.

levels.4: Accurate interpretation of reflective behavior and light interaction.
levels.3: Mostly accurate interpretation with minor errors.
levels.2: Partial understanding of reflections and highlights.
levels.1: Poor understanding of metal surface behavior.

quest9.title: The Alchemist’s Gilded Trial
quest9.rationale:
The Alchemist’s Gilded Trial

Why it’s important:
Gold is a complex color that requires understanding warm/cool shifts and subtle highlights. This quest trains your color intelligence and your ability to render luminous surfaces.

Skills developed:

  • Warm/cool color contrast
  • Subtle value transitions
  • Luminous highlight placement
  • Material realism

It strengthens your ability to paint luxury materials, jewelry, and fantasy details.
quest9.description: The Golden Guild has summoned you to master the art of gilded illustration. Gold is no ordinary metal—it shines, reflects, and radiates light differently than any other surface. Your task is to study its glow, highlights, and subtle color shifts, and render it on your page using careful shading, contrast, and attention to detail. Success in this trial will grant your art the touch of true alchemy.
requirements: Study a piece of gold or reference image carefully
Paint realistic gold surfaces, showing highlights, reflections, and tonal variations
Use shading, contrast, and warm tones to convey its luminosity
Produce a finished painting that convincingly represents gold

levels.4: Gold appears luminous and realistic with strong color shifts.
levels.3: Gold appears realistic with good highlights and warmth.
levels.2: Gold shown but lacks strong value shifts or highlights.
levels.1: Minimal evidence of gold rendering.

levels.4: Excellent interpretation of luminous qualities and reflection logic.
levels.3: Good interpretation with minor inaccuracies.
levels.2: Partial understanding; inconsistent highlights.
levels.1: Poor interpretation of light and material.

quest10.title: The Verdant Painter’s Trial
quest10.rationale:
The Verdant Painter’s Trial

Why it’s important:
Nature is complex and chaotic, but must be simplified into readable marks. This quest teaches you how to translate organic shapes into paint through texture and layered color.

Skills developed:

  • Layering and brushstroke variation
  • Atmospheric depth
  • Organic form and movement
  • Color variation in nature

This is essential for landscapes and environmental painting.
quest10.description: The Wardens of the Green Realm call upon you to study the living language of nature. Trees and grass are ever-changing—shaped by wind, light, and growth. Your task is to observe their forms, colors, and textures, then translate them into paint using layered strokes, value, and color variation. Through this trial, you will bring the landscape to life on your canvas.
requirements: Paint trees and grass within a single composition
Show texture through brushstrokes and layering
Use value and color variation to create depth and form
Demonstrate natural movement and organic shapes.

levels.4: Strong layered texture and depth; clear movement and form.
levels.3: Good texture and depth with minor inconsistencies.
levels.2: Some texture but depth or form is weak.
levels.1: Minimal layering or texture; flat appearance.

levels.4: Excellent interpretation of nature’s complexity and depth.
levels.3: Good interpretation with minor errors.
levels.2: Partial understanding of natural forms.
levels.1: Poor interpretation of nature and depth.

quest11.title: Duel of the Silent Master (Summative)
quest11.rationale:
Duel of the Silent Master (Summative)

Why it’s important:
Still life is the ultimate test of observation. This quest forces you to practice accurate proportion, value, and material rendering under real-world conditions.

Skills developed:

  • Accurate proportion and form
  • Value hierarchy and shading
  • Surface texture and detail
  • Composition and visual balance

Completing this proves readiness for advanced realistic work.
quest11.description:
Within the Grand Arena of Art stands the reigning Most Valuable Painter, a master known for turning simple objects into legendary works. You have been summoned to challenge this champion — not with blades, but with brush and sight.
Before you lies a still life assortment of items: silent, unmoving, yet demanding absolute focus. To defeat the MVP, you must outmatch them in observation, composition, and control of paint. Every shadow must be earned. Every highlight must strike true.
requirements: Study the still life with unwavering focus
Paint the objects with accurate proportion and form
Use value and shading to create depth and realism
Capture surface textures convincingly
Arrange and paint the scene with balance and intention

levels.4: Outstanding realism with excellent control of value and texture.
levels.3: Strong realism with minor technical flaws.
levels.2: Some realism but inconsistencies in value or form.
levels.1: Poor technical execution.

levels.4: Highly refined composition with intentional decisions and polish.
levels.3: Mostly refined with minor inconsistencies.
levels.2: Some refinement; several unresolved areas.
levels.1: Little evidence of refinement.

levels.4: Excellent understanding of form, value, and lighting.
levels.3: Good understanding with minor errors.
levels.2: Partial understanding; some major errors.
levels.1: Poor understanding of form and light.

levels.4: Process documented clearly from idea to final product.
levels.3: Good documentation with minor gaps.
levels.2: Basic documentation; missing major steps.
levels.1: No documentation or process evidence.

quest13.title: The Sigils of Order
quest13.rationale:
The Sigils of Order

Why it’s important:
Patterns teach control, repetition, and rhythm. This quest builds your ability to create visually coherent artwork through intentional mark-making.

Skills developed:

  • Repetition and variation
  • Visual consistency
  • Abstract composition
  • Control over line and shape

This strengthens design skills and visual discipline.
quest13.description: Ancient scribes once controlled chaos through repeated marks and symbols. Now this knowledge should be passed to you. You must design an abstract work built from repetition, variation, and rhythmical order. Pattern may be strict or evolving—but it must command the surface.
requirements: Use repetition of shapes, lines, or marks
Show variation within the pattern
Avoid representational imagery
Create visual consistency across the artwork.
Use colours

levels.4: Pattern is highly controlled, balanced, and intentional.
levels.3: Pattern is clear and consistent with minor flaws.
levels.2: Pattern shows some control but lacks consistency.
levels.1: Pattern is inconsistent or unclear.

levels.4: Composition is organized and balanced with strong visual rhythm.
levels.3: Composition is balanced with minor inconsistencies.
levels.2: Composition shows some organization but is uneven.
levels.1: Composition is unorganized or chaotic.

quest14.title: The Skilled Blacksmith
quest14.rationale:
The Skilled Blacksmith

Why it’s important:
Emphasis is a core visual skill. This quest trains you to control viewer focus using contrast, scale, color, and detail.

Skills developed:

  • Focal point creation
  • Contrast and hierarchy
  • Composition through value and color
  • Abstract storytelling

This is essential for creating strong visual impact in any art style.
quest14.description: The blacksmith Kyrgsth creates one-of-a-kind weapons, and he is looking for someone to pass on his technique. Your task is to create an abstract composition where one area clearly dominates through contrast, scale, color, or detail—while the rest supports it.
requirements: Use contrast (value, color, size, or texture)
Keep the artwork non-representational
Ensure supporting areas enhance the focal point.

levels.4: Focal point is extremely strong and clearly dominant.
levels.3: Focal point is strong and clear.
levels.2: Focal point is present but weak or unclear.
levels.1: No clear focal point.

levels.4: Contrast is used masterfully with strong visual hierarchy.
levels.3: Contrast is effective with minor inconsistencies.
levels.2: Contrast is present but inconsistent.
levels.1: Little to no effective contrast.

quest15.title: The Pulse of Rhythm
quest15.rationale:
The Pulse of Rhythm

Why it’s important:
Movement in art is created through rhythm and repetition. This quest teaches you to guide the viewer’s eye through visual beats without relying on recognizable forms.

Skills developed:

  • Visual tempo and flow
  • Repetition with variation
  • Dynamic composition
  • Non-representational design

It strengthens your ability to create energy and motion in static images.
quest15.description: The Dancers of the Visual Realm believe art can move without motion. Even when static, it looks like they are moving. Learn their technique of the static motion so you can do the same. You must create a non-representational composition that feels alive through repeating elements, flowing transitions, or visual beats.
requirements: Use repetition to suggest movement
Create a sense of visual tempo or flow
Avoid recognizable imagery
Guide the viewer’s eye across the artwork
Don’t mix rhythm and patter.: rhythm uses patterns, but they are not the same thing.

levels.4: Composition has strong rhythm and clear visual flow.
levels.3: Good rhythm with minor inconsistencies.
levels.2: Some rhythm but flow is weak or inconsistent.
levels.1: No clear rhythm or flow.

levels.4: Repetition and variation used skillfully to suggest motion.
levels.3: Repetition and variation used effectively with minor flaws.
levels.2: Some repetition but little variation or motion.
levels.1: Little evidence of repetition or motion.

quest19.title: The Beastbinder’s Study of Fur
quest19.rationale:
The Beastbinder’s Study of Fur

Why it’s important:
Painting fur requires patience, observation, and control. This assessment challenges artists to slow down, study texture, and translate subtle variations in value, direction, and layering into believable surface detail.

Skills developed:

  • Layering and brush control
  • Observation of texture and direction
  • Value shifts and color variation
  • Refinement through revision
quest19.description:
In the archives of the Beastbinders, no creature is judged by shape alone.
Its fur tells the true story.
You must create a painted study focused entirely on rendering fur—real or imagined. Through careful layering, directional strokes, and intentional color shifts, you will bring texture and life to the surface of your work.
requirements: Create a painted study focused on fur texture
Use layering and directional brushstrokes to suggest depth and movement
Show intentional variation in value and color
Revise the work based on observation and reflection

levels.4: Exceptional control of layered techniques resulting in highly realistic or expressive fur texture.
levels.3: Clear and effective use of layering and brushwork to represent fur.
levels.2: Some attempt at layering; texture appears inconsistent or flat.
levels.1: Minimal technique use; fur texture not convincingly represented.

levels.4: Work shows thoughtful revision and refined detail throughout.
levels.3: Evidence of refinement with minor unresolved areas.
levels.2: Limited refinement; revisions are minimal or unclear.
levels.1: No visible effort to refine or revise the work.

quest33.title: The Trial of the Blurred Light
quest33.rationale:
The Trial of the Blurred Light

Why it’s important:
Bokeh is a key technique for creating depth, atmosphere, and cinematic lighting. This quest teaches edge control and layering to simulate soft focus.

Skills developed:

  • Bokeh effect and soft edge control
  • Layered transparency and glow
  • Depth through overlap and blur
  • Atmospheric lighting

This skill improves mood, depth, and lighting in all future work.
quest33.description:
The Luminary Circle teaches that not all light is sharp—some light whispers. Your task is to create an artwork inspired by the bokeh effect, where light dissolves into soft circles, gentle overlaps, and atmospheric glow.
Through careful layering, blending, and control of edges, you will suggest depth and distance, allowing lights to float and fade as if seen through an unfocused lens.
requirements: Create soft, circular light forms
Use blending and layering to soften edges
Show overlapping shapes to suggest depth
Use color and value to create a glowing effect
Avoid sharp outlines or detailed imagery

rubric.overall: The Trial of the Blurred Light

levels.4: Soft focus is excellent with smooth edges and layered depth.
levels.3: Soft focus is clear with minor edge issues.
levels.2: Soft focus is attempted but inconsistent.
levels.1: Little evidence of soft focus or layering.

levels.4: Strong atmospheric interpretation and depth.
levels.3: Good atmospheric effect with minor issues.
levels.2: Some atmosphere but shallow depth.
levels.1: No atmospheric effect.

quest34.title: Trial of Textured Cubes
quest34.rationale:
Trial of Textured Cubes

Why it’s important:
Texture is best learned through simple forms. Cubes isolate texture so you can focus on surface quality without complex anatomy.

Skills developed:

  • Material texture rendering
  • Consistent lighting across surfaces
  • Brushwork variation
  • Form clarity and edge control

This builds the foundation for realistic object rendering.
quest34.description: In this quest, you will explore texture by painting a set of cubes. Each cube must represent a different surface, focusing on how paint application can suggest material.
requirements: Paint/draw at least 4 cubes
Each cube must show a different texture
Use acrylic paint only
Textures must be visually distinct

levels.4: Each texture is distinct and highly convincing.
levels.3: Most textures are clear and distinct.
levels.2: Some textures are unclear or repeated.
levels.1: Textures are not distinct or convincing.

levels.4: Lighting and form are highly consistent and refined.
levels.3: Lighting is consistent with minor issues.
levels.2: Lighting is inconsistent or unclear.
levels.1: Little evidence of lighting or form.

quest35.title: The Beast of the Borderlands
quest35.rationale:
The Beast of the Borderlands

Why it’s important:
Animal painting combines anatomy, texture, and gesture. This quest teaches you how to create believable forms through observation and structure.

Skills developed:

  • Animal anatomy and proportion
  • Texture rendering (fur, scales, feathers)
  • Gesture and form
  • Expressive character design

This strengthens both realism and imaginative creature design.
quest35.description:
Villagers near the borderlands report sightings of a powerful creature whose presence has unsettled the land. You are asked to document the beast through paint, capturing its form and spirit so the elders may understand it.
Your brush must reveal the animal’s strength, texture, and character.
requirements: Paint one animal of your choice
Use acrylic paint
Show clear form and proportions
Include texture such as fur, scales, or feathers

levels.4: Animal anatomy and texture are highly convincing and detailed.
levels.3: Anatomy and texture are accurate with minor issues.
levels.2: Some accuracy but anatomy or texture is weak.
levels.1: Poor anatomy and texture.

levels.4: Strong sense of gesture, form, and character.
levels.3: Good sense of gesture with minor errors.
levels.2: Some gesture but lacks clarity.
levels.1: No clear gesture or character.

quest36.title: Chaos Sealed in Color
quest36.rationale:
Chaos Sealed in Color

Why it’s important:
Abstract art trains emotional expression and visual decision-making. This quest teaches you to use color and composition intentionally without relying on recognizable objects.

Skills developed:

  • Color harmony and contrast
  • Composition through shape and balance
  • Emotional expression through abstraction
  • Controlled visual tension

This develops your ability to communicate mood and energy.
quest36.description:
A rogue force of chaos has leaked into the realm, twisting balance and order. The Guild believes this energy can be contained through abstraction.
You must create a painting that traps raw emotion, movement, and power without relying on recognizable forms.
requirements: Create a fully abstract acrylic painting
Do not include recognizable objects
Use color intentionally
Create visual balance or tension

levels.4: Strong color harmony and tension with intentional composition.
levels.3: Good color use with minor compositional issues.
levels.2: Some color use but composition is weak.
levels.1: Little intentional color or composition.

levels.4: Composition is balanced and powerful, with clear visual intent.
levels.3: Composition is balanced with minor issues.
levels.2: Composition shows some balance but is inconsistent.
levels.1: Composition is disorganized.

quest37.title: The Alchemist’s Spill
quest37.rationale:
The Alchemist’s Spill

Why it’s important:
Fluid art teaches you to collaborate with chance while maintaining composition. This quest trains you to guide paint flow while still creating a complete image.

Skills developed:

  • Fluid acrylic control
  • Compositional awareness
  • Color mixing through movement
  • Working with randomness intentionally

This improves spontaneity and creative problem-solving.
quest37.description:
A couple of alchemist’s experiment has gone awry, spilling enchanted pigments across the workshop. Instead of cleaning the mess, you are asked to study it.
By guiding the flow of paint, you will uncover hidden patterns within the chaos.
requirements: Create an acrylic pour painting
Use fluid acrylic techniques
Allow paint to move naturally
Finish with a complete composition

levels.4: Fluid control is excellent with intentional composition.
levels.3: Good fluid control with minor compositional issues.
levels.2: Some fluid control but composition is weak.
levels.1: Poor fluid control or composition.

levels.4: Composition is cohesive and balanced despite randomness.
levels.3: Composition is mostly cohesive with minor issues.
levels.2: Composition is uneven or unbalanced.
levels.1: Composition is chaotic and unclear.

quest51.title: The Winter’s Gift
quest51.rationale:
The Winter’s Gift

Why it’s important:
Seasonal themes teach atmosphere and storytelling. This quest trains you to use color and composition to create mood and narrative.

Skills developed:

  • Mood through color and value
  • Atmospheric perspective
  • Storytelling through imagery
  • Focal point emphasis

This builds your ability to create emotionally resonant art.
quest51.description:
As the year draws to a close, the realm enters the season of stillness and light. Villages are adorned with symbols of warmth, generosity, and hope to push back the long nights.
You see a jolly old man that asks you to create a painting that captures the spirit of Christmas: whether through imagery of winter, celebration, or quiet moments of peace. This work will be displayed to lift the hearts of the people.
requirements: Create a painting inspired by Christmas or winter themes
Use color to suggest mood and atmosphere
Include at least one clear focal point
Complete the painting with care and detail

levels.4: Strong mood and atmosphere with excellent technical execution.
levels.3: Good mood and atmosphere with minor technical flaws.
levels.2: Some mood shown but technical execution is weak.
levels.1: Little evidence of mood or technical skill.

levels.4: Strong narrative and emotional resonance.
levels.3: Good narrative with minor issues.
levels.2: Some narrative but unclear or inconsistent.
levels.1: No clear narrative or emotion.

quest52.title: Night of Whispering Shadows
quest52.rationale:
Night of Whispering Shadows

Why it’s important:
Dark and spooky themes train value control and dramatic lighting. This quest teaches you to create mood through shadow, contrast, and symbolism.

Skills developed:

  • Strong value contrast
  • Atmospheric lighting
  • Symbolic composition
  • Mood-driven color choices

This improves your ability to create cinematic and emotional scenes.
quest52.description:
On the eve when the veil grows thin, strange lights flicker and shadows seem to move on their own. The people gather to ward off fear through stories, symbols, and bold imagery, but nothing can stop the Witch Luri.
On her sight, you can do nothing but what you are told...Luri tasks with creating a painting inspired by Halloween, embracing mystery, imagination, and the playful darkness of the season.
requirements: Create a painting inspired by Halloween/Dark/Mystery themes
Use color or value to create a mysterious mood
Include imaginative or symbolic imagery
Establish a clear atmosphere

levels.4: Strong value contrast and atmospheric lighting with clear mood.
levels.3: Good contrast and mood with minor issues.
levels.2: Some contrast but mood is weak.
levels.1: Little evidence of contrast or mood.

levels.4: Strong symbolism and emotional impact.
levels.3: Good symbolism with minor issues.
levels.2: Some symbolism but unclear.
levels.1: No symbolism or mood.

quest55.title: The Skycaller’s Feather Study
quest55.rationale:
The Skycaller’s Feather Study

Why it’s important:
Feathers require precision, rhythm, and sensitivity to light. This quest pushes artists to control edges, observe structure, and use value and color shifts to suggest delicacy and movement.

Skills developed:

  • Controlled brushwork
  • Layering and edge control
  • Observation of structure and overlap
  • Use of value and color to suggest lightness
quest55.description:
High above the world, the Skycallers study the language of flight.
Each feather carries order, rhythm, and balance.
A famous Akycaller monster terrorize the village nearby. To defeat it, you must understand it.
You must create a painted study focused on feathers, capturing their structure, overlap, and sense of light through careful brushwork and layered color.
requirements: Create a painted study focused on feathers
Show clear feather structure and overlap
Use controlled brushstrokes to suggest lightness and direction
Apply layered color and value to create depth

levels.4: Exceptional control of brushwork and layering creates highly convincing feather texture.
levels.3: Effective use of brushwork and layering to represent feathers.
levels.2: Some technical control shown; feathers lack consistency or clarity.
levels.1: Minimal control; feather texture not effectively communicated.

levels.4: Feather forms are highly refined with intentional adjustments throughout.
levels.3: Work shows refinement with minor unresolved areas.
levels.2: Limited refinement; several areas appear unfinished.
levels.1: Little evidence of refinement or revision.

quest64.title: The Glasswright’s Illusion
quest64.rationale:
The Glasswright’s Illusion

Why it’s important:
Painting glass is not about painting the object itself, but the distortion of light, color, and space around it. This quest trains artists to observe highlights, refraction, and value contrast in order to create the illusion of transparency.

Skills developed:

  • Observation of light and refraction
  • High-contrast value control
  • Edge precision and softness
  • Refinement through adjustment
quest64.description:
The desert play trics on everyone, nothing is solid as it seems.
Light bends. Colors shift. Edges disappear and return.
While walking, you notice a transparent mountain made of glass. Impressed, you decide to create a painted study of glass (clear or colored) focusing on highlights, reflections, refraction, and the distortion of forms seen through it.
requirements: Create a painted study of a glass object
Show strong highlights and value contrast to suggest transparency
Demonstrate distortion or refraction of objects seen through the glass
Refine edges and values to strengthen the illusion

levels.4: Exceptional control of value, highlights, and edges creates a convincing illusion of glass.
levels.3: Effective use of value and highlights to suggest transparency.
levels.2: Some understanding shown; glass appears partially flat or opaque.
levels.1: Limited technique; transparency not effectively communicated.

levels.4: Highly refined with precise adjustments that enhance realism.
levels.3: Refined overall with minor inconsistencies.
levels.2: Limited refinement; several areas weaken the illusion.
levels.1: Little evidence of refinement or revision.

quest66.title: Bastions of Light and Stone
quest66.rationale:
Bastions of Light and Stone

Why it’s important:
Landscapes and architecture require understanding space, structure, and light. Acrylic paint adds an extra challenge due to its fast drying time and opacity. This quest trains you to build depth, control edges, and balance structure with expressive color.

Skills developed:

  • Foreground, midground, and background separation
  • Basic perspective and architectural structure
  • Layering opaque and semi-opaque acrylic paint
  • Edge control (hard vs soft)
  • Light, shadow, and atmospheric depth

This quest prepares you for more complex environmental and architectural summative works.
quest66.description:
Deep in the abandon castle of Lord Von-Kvar, his mechanical assistant still works, finishing his last research. Old age and mall function threatens to unlish a devastating power that can be postponed if she is bussy with more research.
You are tasked with painting a landscape or architectural scene using acrylic paint to keep her busy until the King can deactvate her.
Structure must guide the image, while color and light bring it to life.
Balance solid form with atmospheric depth, and allow the environment to feel believable and intentional.
requirements: Create an acrylic painting of a landscape or architectural scene
Show clear foreground, midground, and background
Include architectural elements or built structures (buildings, ruins, bridges, etc.)
Use layering to establish light, shadow, and depth
Demonstrate control of edges and paint opacity

levels.4: Excellent control of acrylic layering, opacity, and clean color application.
levels.3: Good control with minor layering or opacity issues.
levels.2: Basic control; layering or opacity is inconsistent.
levels.1: Poor paint control and unclear layering.

levels.4: Strong depth with clear perspective and well-structured architectural forms.
levels.3: Good depth with minor perspective or structural issues.
levels.2: Limited depth or unclear structural logic.
levels.1: No clear depth or structural organization.

levels.4: Balanced composition with strong focal points and visual flow.
levels.3: Mostly balanced composition with minor issues.
levels.2: Uneven or weak composition.
levels.1: Poor composition and lack of focus.

quest67.title: The Pressmaster’s Mark
quest67.rationale:
The Pressmaster’s Mark

Why it’s important:
Printmaking teaches artists to think in layers, reversals, and intentional marks. This quest emphasizes planning, process awareness, and craftsmanship while exploring the unique visual qualities of printed images.

Skills developed:

  • Understanding positive and negative space
  • Intentional mark-making
  • Process control and sequencing
  • Craftsmanship and edition consistency
quest67.description:
Deep within the caves of Orign, an old man stares at the walls, filled with printings of old tribes. Their ability to record stories with simple work is impressive and you decide to try as well.
You must design and create a print. Through carving, layering, or inking, you will transfer your image from matrix to paper with clarity and intention.
requirements: Create a print using an approved printmaking process
Demonstrate intentional use of positive and negative space
Show clear, deliberate mark-making
Produce at least one clean, well-printed impression

levels.4: Exceptional control of tools and process results in a highly refined print.
levels.3: Effective use of printmaking techniques with clear results.
levels.2: Some control shown; printing or carving is inconsistent.
levels.1: Limited understanding of printmaking process.

levels.4: Print is in colours.
levels.3: Print is a refined monochrome with minor inconsistencies.
levels.2: Limited refinement; unresolved or messy areas remain.
levels.1: Little evidence of refinement.

quest69.title: The Painted Visage
quest69.rationale:
The Painted Visage

Why it’s important:
Portraiture demands both technical control and perceptual accuracy. This quest introduces students to observing and interpreting the human face while managing acrylic paint intentionally.

Skills developed:

  • Facial proportion and structure
  • Skin tone mixing and value control
  • Expressive brushwork
  • Critical self-reflection and revision

This quest bridges technical practice and meaningful representation.
quest69.description:
Kuraki is a trickster kitsune that loves pretending she's human. Her embodyment of humans is so good that people started to doubt each other.
To help people, you must create an acrylic portrait that demonstrates observation, intentional technique, and thoughtful refinement.
The face must feel constructed, not symbolic, and the paint must do the work.
requirements: Create one acrylic painted portrait of a real person (self or other)
Demonstrate accurate facial proportions and structure
Use intentional color mixing for skin tones and values
Pay attention to the composition

levels.4: Multiple strong compositional approaches explored before final portrait.
levels.3: Clear planning and thoughtful initial approach.
levels.2: Limited exploration; relies on a single approach.
levels.1: Minimal planning or exploration evident.

levels.4: Highly confident handling of acrylic techniques and color mixing.
levels.3: Effective use of acrylic techniques with minor inconsistencies.
levels.2: Basic technique use; control and mixing need improvement.
levels.1: Minimal technique control; paint use is ineffective.

levels.4: Revisions significantly improve accuracy and expression.
levels.3: Revisions clearly improve the portrait.
levels.2: Minor revisions made with limited impact.
levels.1: No meaningful revision evident.

levels.4: Strong understanding of facial structure, form, and paint interaction.
levels.3: Clear understanding of form and structure.
levels.2: Partial understanding; some structural issues.
levels.1: Little understanding of facial form or structure.

links.type: how to mix skin colour in acrylic sample

quest32.title: The Elven Rite of Flowing Pigment
quest32.rationale:
The Elven Rite of Flowing Pigment

Why it’s important:
Watercolor requires a completely different mindset than acrylic or digital painting. It teaches you to think in terms of water, timing, and transparency — skills that strengthen observation and control.

Skills developed:

  • Understanding water-to-pigment ratios
  • Controlled washes (wet-on-wet & wet-on-dry)
  • Color lifting and blooming techniques
  • Layering without losing luminosity
  • Patience, timing, and planning

This quest builds the foundation for all watercolor work, teaching you how to guide the paint instead of forcing it.
quest32.description:
In the hidden glades of Lúminalë, the Elves teach that watercolor is not forced, it is invited. You have been chosen to study their sacred methods, where water and pigment move as one.
Through patience and balance, you will learn to guide the flow rather than command it.Under elven guidance, you will practice the foundational rites of watercolor: washes that drift like morning mist, pigments that bloom like forest flowers, and layers as light as falling leaves.
requirements: Create a sample of watercolor techniques
Make sure to have at least 10 different techniques
be aware of time and water content, they are crucial for a proper watercolour work

rubric.overall: The Elven Rite of Flowing Pigment

levels.4: Demonstrates 10+ techniques with excellent control, timing, and intentional effects.
levels.3: Shows 10 techniques with mostly consistent control and water/pigment balance.
levels.2: Shows 8–9 techniques with inconsistent control or timing.
levels.1: Shows 7 or fewer techniques; poor control of water and pigment.

levels.4: Strong refinement; clear planning and careful corrections improve the work.
levels.3: Some refinement and adjustments are visible and improve the final piece.
levels.2: Limited refinement; several areas look unfinished or rushed.
levels.1: No evidence of refinement or thoughtful revision.

quest16.title: The Silent Objects Trial
quest16.rationale:
The Silent Objects Trial

Why it’s important:
Still life forces you to see how light behaves on real surfaces. Watercolor is unforgiving, so this trial trains precision and accuracy in observation.

Skills developed:

  • Value control with transparent layers
  • Creating depth using light and shadow
  • Surface texture through controlled washes
  • Accurate proportion and composition
  • Managing edges (hard vs soft)

This quest improves your realism and teaches you to paint with intention.
quest16.description:
The Elders of the Quiet Hall have arranged a collection of objects for careful study. Your task is to observe how light, shadow, and surface interact within a still life.
Through controlled washes and layering, you will transform simple objects into a unified watercolor composition.
requirements: Create a watercolor still life with 3 or more objects
Show accurate form and proportion
Use value and shading to create depth
Represent different surface textures (smooth, rough, reflective, etc.)
Create a balanced composition

levels.4: Exceptional control of washes, values, and edge control with clean, confident layers.
levels.3: Good control of washes and values with minor inconsistencies.
levels.2: Basic control; uneven washes or muddy values.
levels.1: Poor control; unclear values and messy wash work.

levels.4: Strong observation with refined detail and clear light/shadow decisions.
levels.3: Good observation with some refined areas.
levels.2: Partial observation; several areas lack accurate light/shadow.
levels.1: Weak observation; forms and shadows are unclear.

levels.4: Balanced composition with strong structure and depth.
levels.3: Mostly balanced with good depth.
levels.2: Composition is uneven or depth is unclear.
levels.1: Poor composition and lack of depth.

quest17.title: The Elven Vista Trial
quest17.rationale:
The Elven Vista Trial

Why it’s important:
Landscapes demand control of distance, atmosphere, and light. Watercolor is perfect for atmospheric depth, but it requires planning and timing.

Skills developed:

  • Atmospheric perspective (foreground vs background)
  • Wet-on-wet blending for soft skies
  • Layering to build depth
  • Controlling water and pigment flow
  • Creating harmony in color temperature

This quest teaches you to translate real scenery into expressive watercolor language.
quest17.description: The Elven Council of Light calls upon you to translate a captured moment of the land into flowing pigment. Using a photograph you have taken, you must recreate the landscape in watercolor./nFocus on atmosphere, depth, and harmony as water and color shape the scene.
requirements: Use a photograph taken by yourself as reference
Create a watercolor landscape
Use wet-on-wet and wet-on-dry techniques
Show foreground, middle ground, and background
Demonstrate control of water and pigment

levels.4: Excellent wet-on-wet and layering control with strong color harmony.
levels.3: Good control with minor inconsistencies in washes or edges.
levels.2: Basic technique with uneven washes or weak layering.
levels.1: Poor control; wash techniques are not effective.

levels.4: Strong atmospheric perspective with clear depth and distance.
levels.3: Good depth but some layers lack clarity.
levels.2: Limited depth; foreground and background merge.
levels.1: No depth or atmospheric effect.

levels.4: Clear process and planning shown; reference used effectively.
levels.3: Some planning evident; reference is used adequately.
levels.2: Minimal planning; reference is not fully used.
levels.1: No evidence of planning or process.

levels.4: Composition clearly conveys mood, atmosphere, and balance.
levels.3: Composition is strong but lacks some harmony or clarity.
levels.2: Composition is weak or uneven.
levels.1: Composition is confusing or unbalanced.

quest22.title: The Nymph's Still Life Request
quest22.rationale:
The Nymph's Still Life Request

Why it’s important:
Copying a still life in watercolor trains careful observation, patience, and control of water, pigment, and timing. This quest emphasizes seeing relationships between objects, color shifts, and value transitions rather than symbolic representation.

Skills developed:

  • Observation and proportion
  • Water and pigment control
  • Layering through washes
  • Accurate color and value matching
quest22.description:
In the quiet halls of the Acquaheim, nothing is imagined.
Every edge, shadow, and hue must be earned through observation. Lara, the  water nymph, is looking for someone to record the fleeting effect of her objects.
You must copy either a single object or a complete watercolor still life, focusing on accurate proportion, color, value, and the relationships between forms.
requirements: Select a single object or a full still life to copy
Accurately represent proportions and placement
Use controlled watercolor washes to build value and color
Match observed colors and shadows as closely as possible

levels.4: Highly accurate interpretation of form, color, and value through watercolor technique.
levels.3: Clear and accurate observation with effective use of watercolor.
levels.2: Partial accuracy; some proportions, colors, or values are inconsistent.
levels.1: Minimal accuracy; observation skills not effectively applied.

levels.4: Exceptional control of water, pigment, and layering throughout the painting.
levels.3: Good control of watercolor techniques with minor issues.
levels.2: Inconsistent control; washes or edges are uneven.
levels.1: Limited control of watercolor media.

quest23.title: Rite of the Blooming Grove
quest23.rationale:
Rite of the Blooming Grove

Why it’s important:
Flowers are ideal for learning watercolor because they rely on soft edges and transparent color. This quest teaches you how to create form using minimal brushwork.

Skills developed:

  • Wet-on-wet gradients for petals
  • Layering to create shape and depth
  • Color harmony in nature
  • Delicate detail without heavy paint
  • Controlled pigment flow

This quest develops the ability to paint delicate subjects with confidence and softness.
quest23.description:
The elve of the forest calls for a study of flowers, where color flows gently and form emerges through layers.
Soft washes and careful observation will bring the flowers to life.
requirements: Create a watercolor painting of flowers
Use wet-on-wet and wet-on-dry techniques
Apply light, transparent washes
Use layering to build form
Control water and pigment

levels.4: Excellent wet-on-wet and layering with smooth transitions and soft edges.
levels.3: Good technique with minor edge issues.
levels.2: Basic technique; uneven transitions.
levels.1: Poor technique; harsh edges and poor layering.

levels.4: Strong observation with clear form and depth.
levels.3: Good observation with mostly accurate form.
levels.2: Partial observation; some forms are unclear.
levels.1: Weak observation; form is not visible.

levels.4: Colors are harmonious and natural with balanced temperature.
levels.3: Good harmony with minor color inconsistencies.
levels.2: Color is inconsistent or clashes.
levels.1: Poor color harmony and muddy mixing.

quest24.title: Horizon of Flowing Light
quest24.rationale:
Horizon of Flowing Light

Why it’s important:
City landscapes teach scale, perspective, and atmosphere. Watercolor is perfect for expressing distant light, haze, and soft gradients.

Skills developed:

  • Foreground/midground/background separation
  • Wet-on-wet blending for sky and distance
  • Layering for depth and structure
  • Controlled washes for architecture
  • Color temperature and mood

This quest helps you capture space, light, and depth in a single scene.
quest24.description:
Garm is amazing by the big city and needs some help. You are tasked with painting a landscape using watercolor, capturing space, distance, and atmosphere.
Foreground, middle ground, and background must work together in harmony.
requirements: copy a watercolor landscape
Use wet-on-wet and wet-on-dry techniques
Apply transparent washes
Show foreground, middle ground, and background
Control water and pigment

levels.4: Excellent wash control with smooth gradients and clean layering.
levels.3: Good wash control with minor issues.
levels.2: Inconsistent washes or uneven water control.
levels.1: Poor wash control; messy or uncontrolled water usage.

levels.4: Strong depth with clear foreground, midground, and background.
levels.3: Good depth with minor clarity issues.
levels.2: Limited depth; layers blend together.
levels.1: No sense of depth or perspective.

quest25.title: Chronicle of Living Stone
quest25.rationale:
Chronicle of Living Stone

Why it’s important:
Architecture requires strong linework and clean structure. Watercolor forces you to balance precision with fluidity.

Skills developed:

  • Controlled linework and perspective
  • Clean washes for surfaces
  • Layering to show form and shadow
  • Balancing hard edges and soft washes
  • Creating structure without overworking

This quest builds the ability to combine drawing discipline with watercolor flow.
quest25.description:
Structures rise where line meets flow. Your task is to create a watercolor architectural drawing.
Strong drawing must support soft washes of color and light.
requirements: Create a watercolor architectural drawing
Begin with clear structural line work
Use transparent washes
Apply layering for depth
Control water and pigment

levels.4: Exceptional line precision and wash control with clean structure.
levels.3: Good precision and wash control with minor inconsistencies.
levels.2: Line or wash control is inconsistent.
levels.1: Poor line accuracy and uncontrolled washes.

levels.4: Strong depth and form with clear perspective and structure.
levels.3: Good depth with minor perspective issues.
levels.2: Limited depth; structure is unclear.
levels.1: No depth or structure.

levels.4: Balanced composition with strong focal structure.
levels.3: Balanced composition with minor issues.
levels.2: Uneven composition.
levels.1: Poor composition and balance.

levels.4: Clear planning and process evident, improving final outcome.
levels.3: Some planning and process is visible.
levels.2: Minimal planning or process.
levels.1: No evidence of planning or process.

quest26.title: The Living Visage
quest26.rationale:
The Living Visage

Why it’s important:
Portraits require accuracy and subtlety. Watercolor portraiture is especially challenging because you cannot fully erase mistakes.

Skills developed:

  • Facial proportion and structure
  • Soft shading with transparent layers
  • Building form through color value
  • Hair texture with controlled brushwork
  • Skin tone layering without mudding colors

This quest improves your ability to capture likeness using delicate watercolor control.
quest26.description:
Alarik, the Snake lord is using his brush to steal people's faces. You are tasked in contering him by showing that your painting skills can rival his.
You must paint a watercolor portrait, allowing features to emerge through gentle layers.
Softness and control are essential.
requirements: Create watercolor sketches of the eye, mouth, nose, hair texture and skin
Show accurate facial proportions
Use light, transparent washes
Layer to build form and value
Control water and pigment

levels.4: Exceptional wash control and facial rendering with clear value transitions.
levels.3: Good wash control with minor value inconsistencies.
levels.2: Inconsistent wash control or weak values.
levels.1: Poor wash control; values are muddy or unclear.

levels.4: Accurate facial proportions and strong observational detail.
levels.3: Mostly accurate proportions with minor issues.
levels.2: Some proportion errors or missing details.
levels.1: Incorrect proportions and weak observation.

levels.4: Natural skin tones and harmonious color choices.
levels.3: Good color harmony with minor issues.
levels.2: Color harmony is weak or inconsistent.
levels.1: Poor color harmony; skin tones are unnatural.

quest27.title: Duel with Loki, The Trickster
quest27.rationale:
Duel with Loki, The Trickster

Why it’s important:
This is a summative portrait challenge that tests your control, observation, and confidence. Watercolor portraits require planning, patience, and precision.

Skills developed:

  • Accurate facial structure and expression
  • Advanced layering for depth
  • Maintaining highlights and glow
  • Controlled edges and texture
  • Water-to-pigment mastery

Completing this quest proves you can create strong, lifelike portraits using watercolor’s unique strengths.
quest27.description:
In the twilight halls of the Eldritch Arena, Loki waits. His trickery eluding others. Recognizing him is a challenge and a test.
To face him, you must craft a watercolor portrait that captures someone likeness, character, and presence with delicate yet decisive strokes.
Every wash of color, every layer of pigment, must convey depth, emotion, and subtlety. Your artwork is your weapon; only one who can render Loki’s essence convincingly can hope to match his legendary power.
requirements: Create watercolor portrait
Begin with accurate proportions and facial structure
Use transparent washes to build light and shadow
Apply layering to add depth and dimension
Demonstrate mastery of water and pigment control and remember to keep the highlights as watercolour is unforgivin

levels.4: Masterful layering with controlled highlights and depth.
levels.3: Strong layering with minor highlight or value issues.
levels.2: Layering is uneven or highlights are lost.
levels.1: Poor layering and uncontrolled washes.

levels.4: Highly accurate proportions and strong likeness.
levels.3: Mostly accurate with minor proportional errors.
levels.2: Some proportional issues and weak likeness.

levels.3: Planning is visible and supports the outcome.
levels.2: Minimal planning; process is unclear.
