quest49.title: The Oath of the Four Nobles
quest49.rationale:
The Oath of the Four Nobles

Why it’s important:
This traditional study emphasizes controlled brushwork and composition. It teaches discipline and expressive mark-making, which are essential for any watercolor artist.

Skills developed:

  • Controlled, confident brush strokes
  • Negative space composition
  • Expressive line and gesture
  • Balance between simplicity and detail
  • Rhythm and repetition in marks

This quest strengthens brush control and expressive painting in a classical style.
quest49.description:
Beyond the eastern mountains lies the Monastery of Flowing Ink, where the masters guarded an ancient tradition known as the Four Nobles. Each plant represents a virtue: resilience, humility, integrity, and balance.
Now Wednesday, the Solemn, lives there alone, keeping the knowledge of the past for herself. You are summoned to quietly study these forms and translate their spirit using watercolor, mastering brush control, negative space, and expressive marks. Only those who honor all four may complete the oath.
requirements: Create watercolor studies of plum, orchid, bamboo, and chrysanthemum
Demonstrate controlled brush strokes
Use expressive line and shape
Balance positive and negative space

rubric.overall: The Oath of the Four Nobles

levels.4: Excellent brush control with confident strokes and expressive marks.
levels.3: Good control with mostly confident strokes.
levels.2: Some control issues; strokes are uneven.
levels.1: Poor brush control; marks are weak or messy.

levels.4: Strong balance of positive and negative space with clear composition.
levels.3: Balanced composition with minor spacing issues.
levels.2: Composition is uneven or crowded.
levels.1: Composition lacks balance and clarity.

levels.4: Expressive gesture and rhythm are clear and consistent.
levels.3: Gesture is mostly expressive with minor inconsistencies.
levels.2: Gesture is weak or inconsistent.
levels.1: No gesture or expression visible.

quest50.title: Legacy of Azure and Verdant Peaks
quest50.rationale:
Legacy of Azure and Verdant Peaks

Why it’s important:
This quest introduces the 青綠 (Blue-Green) style, emphasizing layered color, decorative composition, and calm atmosphere. It teaches patience and precision in watercolor.

Skills developed:

  • Layered washes for depth
  • Controlled color mixing and harmony
  • Atmospheric perspective using transparent layers
  • Balanced negative space and detail
  • Deliberate, decorative composition

This quest develops mastery of layered watercolor landscapes and traditional composition principles.
quest50.description:
Having sworn the Oath of the Four Nobles, you go deeper into the Monastery’s archives, where you meet a masked man going through ancient scrolls from the Tang dynasty. These works shimmer with mineral blues and greens, depicting mountains not as places, but as symbols of harmony between earth and heaven.
Your task is to study the 青綠 tradition and create a watercolor landscape inspired by its principles—layered mountains, decorative color, and timeless stillness. This trial demands patience, precision, and reverence for tradition.
requirements: Create a watercolor landscape inspired by the 青綠 (Blue-Green) style
Use layered washes to build mountains and depth
Apply controlled, decorative color
Show balance between detail and negative space

rubric.overall: Legacy of Azure and Verdant Peaks

levels.4: Exceptional layering and color control with strong mineral blue/green harmony.
levels.3: Good layering and color control with minor issues.
levels.2: Layering is inconsistent or colors are muddy.
levels.1: Poor layering and color control.

levels.4: Strong atmospheric depth with clear distance and layering.
levels.3: Good depth with minor clarity issues.
levels.2: Limited depth; layers are unclear.
levels.1: No sense of depth or atmosphere.

levels.4: Balanced decorative composition with clear harmony.
levels.3: Good composition with minor imbalance.
levels.2: Composition is uneven or lacks harmony.
levels.1: Composition lacks structure or balance.

quest65.title: The Mistkeeper’s Depth Trial
quest65.rationale:
The Mistkeeper’s Depth Trial

Why it’s important:
Atmospheric perspective teaches artists how distance affects color, value, and clarity. In watercolor, this skill relies on restraint, transparency, and subtle shifts rather than heavy detail.

Skills developed:

  • Understanding depth through value and color
  • Controlled transparency and soft edges
  • Layering washes to suggest distance
  • Visual hierarchy and spatial awareness
quest65.description:
Beyond the lowlands lies the realm of the Mistkeepers, where space is measured in fading edges and softened color. The mist and distance create a unique effect in the atmosphere.
You must create a watercolor painting that clearly demonstrates atmospheric perspective, using washes, value shifts, and reduced detail to show foreground, middle ground, and background.
requirements: Create a watercolor painting with a clear sense of depth
Show distinct foreground, middle ground, and background
Use lighter values, softer edges, and reduced detail to suggest distance
Apply transparent washes to build atmospheric effects

levels.4: Atmospheric perspective is masterfully applied with convincing depth and spatial clarity.
levels.3: Clear use of atmospheric perspective with effective depth cues.
levels.2: Some depth indicated, but spatial relationships are inconsistent.
levels.1: Little or no sense of atmospheric perspective.

levels.4: Exceptional control of washes and edges enhances depth and atmosphere.
levels.3: Good control of watercolor techniques with minor issues.
levels.2: Inconsistent control of washes or edges limits depth.
levels.1: Limited control of watercolor media.

quest12.title: The Path of the Endless Line
quest12.rationale:
The Path of the Endless Line

Why it’s important:
This quest teaches the foundational power of line in drawing. Line is the backbone of all visual art, and mastering it improves confidence, control, and visual rhythm.

Skills developed:

  • Line consistency and flow
  • Controlled variation in thickness and pressure
  • Gesture and movement through line
  • Compositional balance using line density
  • Non-representational abstraction and creative restraint

This quest builds essential mark-making skills and strengthens your ability to create expressive drawings from minimal elements.
quest12.description: The Order of Wayfinders teaches that every journey begins with a single line. Your task is to create a one-line drawing. It may twist, overlap or thicken, but it must be continuous.
requirements: Use line as the primary element
Vary line thickness, direction, and density
Avoid recognizable objects or symbols
Fill the space with purposeful linear movement.

rubric.overall: The Path of the Endless Line

levels.4: Line work is highly controlled, varied, and intentional throughout.
levels.3: Line work is clear and varied, with good control overall.
levels.2: Some line variation, but control is inconsistent.
levels.1: Line is mostly uniform or uncontrolled, with little variation.

levels.4: Composition is balanced and purposeful; line movement feels deliberate.
levels.3: Composition is mostly balanced with clear intention.
levels.2: Composition is uneven; intent is unclear in several areas.
levels.1: Composition lacks structure; no clear intention.

quest18.title: The Watchful Eye Trial
quest18.rationale:
The Watchful Eye Trial

Why it’s important:
Eyes are one of the most expressive features in portraiture. This quest teaches you how to see structure, proportions, and the subtle shifts of light that bring life to a drawing.

Skills developed:

  • Accurate eye anatomy and placement
  • Understanding of form through shading
  • Rendering reflections and highlights
  • Control of value transitions
  • Observation of subtle details like eyelids and lashes

This quest strengthens your ability to capture realism and emotion through careful observation and shading.
quest18.description:
The Academy of Observation begins with the study of the eye. Your task is to draw eyes in pencil, focusing on structure, proportion, and shading.
Careful observation will bring depth and life to the drawing.
requirements: Draw one or more eyes in pencil
Show correct eye structure and proportions
Use shading to create form and depth
Include iris, pupil, and highlights

levels.4: Shading and detail are highly refined, showing strong control of value.
levels.3: Shading is clear and consistent, with good control of value.
levels.2: Shading is basic; value transitions are uneven.
levels.1: Shading is minimal or unclear; form is not defined.

levels.4: Eyes are accurately proportioned with realistic anatomy and placement.
levels.3: Proportion is mostly accurate with minor anatomical errors.
levels.2: Proportion is inconsistent; anatomy is unclear.
levels.1: Proportion is incorrect and anatomy is not recognizable.

quest20.title: The Bridge of Structure
quest20.rationale:
The Bridge of Structure

Why it’s important:
The nose is a study of planes and light. Drawing it correctly teaches you to think in 3D, using value to build form instead of relying on outlines.

Skills developed:

  • Understanding facial planes and structure
  • Value-based shading for volume
  • Soft blending and edge control
  • Observing light direction and shadow placement
  • Reducing outlines for realistic form

This quest improves your ability to render facial features with depth and accuracy.
quest20.description:
The nose is a study of planes and light. Your task is to draw the nose in pencil using shading to define form rather than relying on outlines.
Understanding light direction will determine the strength of your drawing.
requirements: Draw a nose in pencil
Show basic structural planes
Use shading to create depth
Avoid strong outlines

levels.4: Form is fully defined with smooth, realistic shading.
levels.3: Form is clear with good shading and light direction.
levels.2: Form is partially defined; shading is uneven.
levels.1: Form is unclear; shading is minimal or incorrect.

levels.4: Planes and structure are highly accurate and believable.
levels.3: Structure is mostly correct with minor errors.
levels.2: Structure is inconsistent and partially incorrect.
levels.1: Structure is incorrect or not recognizable.

quest21.title: Framework of the Face
quest21.rationale:
Framework of the Face

Why it’s important:
Portrait drawing requires correct proportion, structure, and shading. This quest teaches you to build a face from accurate construction rather than guessing.

Skills developed:

  • Head construction and proportion
  • Placement of facial features
  • Understanding facial planes and form
  • Shading for volume and depth
  • Using reference effectively

This quest strengthens your ability to create realistic portraits with strong foundational structure.
quest21.description: On top of the Tower skelfingarandlit a mystical item resides.A mirror that steals the faces of those who dare to look. To counter its powers you must draw a portrait in pencil/charcoal, combining proportion, structure, and shading.
requirements: Draw a full head in pencil/charcoal
Use a photo taken by you as reference
Show correct overall proportions
Place facial features accurately
Use shading to suggest volume

levels.4: Exceptional shading and texture; forms appear fully 3D.
levels.3: Good shading and form; clear volume.
levels.2: Basic shading; form is partially readable.
levels.1: Minimal shading; form lacks depth.

levels.4: Proportions are accurate and construction is highly solid.
levels.3: Proportions are mostly correct with minor issues.
levels.2: Proportions are inconsistent or off in several areas.
levels.1: Proportions are incorrect and construction is weak.

levels.4: Reference is used effectively; process shows strong planning.
levels.3: Reference is used appropriately; process is clear.
levels.2: Reference is used but not fully integrated; process is incomplete.
levels.1: Reference is ignored or not used; no evidence of process.

quest29.title: Whisper of Expression
quest29.rationale:
Whisper of Expression

Why it’s important:
Mouths communicate emotion through subtle shape changes. Drawing them accurately teaches control over contour, proportion, and shading.

Skills developed:

  • Accurate lip structure and proportion
  • Value-based shading for volume
  • Subtle expression through shape
  • Edge control without heavy outlines
  • Observation of light on curved surfaces

This quest builds expressive portrait skills and improves subtlety in rendering facial features.
quest29.description: The mountain of Ithrihill are the home of Flora. She calls for her pray and devour it whole. To better understand its emotions you must draw mouths using pencil/charcoal with restraint and accuracy.
requirements: Draw a mouth in pencil/charcoal
Show correct proportions
Use shading to suggest form
Avoid heavy outlines

levels.4: Form is realistic with subtle shading and clean edges.
levels.3: Good form and shading with minor edge issues.
levels.2: Form is weak; shading is inconsistent.
levels.1: Form is unclear; shading is minimal.

levels.4: Proportions are accurate with refined detail and expression.
levels.3: Proportions are mostly correct with clear detail.
levels.2: Proportions are inconsistent; details are vague.
levels.1: Proportions are incorrect and details are missing.

quest30.title: The Threat of the East
quest30.rationale:
The Threat of the East

Why it’s important:
This quest introduces full composition and storytelling through character design. It challenges you to combine proportion, dynamic pose, and style in a coherent scene.

Skills developed:

  • Character proportion and anatomy
  • Dynamic pose and action
  • Composition and layout
  • Shading for volume and depth
  • Manga-style stylization and line work

This quest strengthens your ability to create compelling scenes and character-driven narrative drawings.
quest30.description:
Up in the sky you see a flying man. Icarusan is after Chloris and the knowledge of the East. As a friend and protector, you intervene and a gruesome drawing battle begins.
To win, you must creat a full scene with Manga heros.
requirements: You must create a full composition with characters following the Japanese manga style
Show correct proportions
Use shading to suggest form
It MUST have original elements (composition, colour, etc)
You can draw known characters or create your own

levels.4: Lines and shading are confident, clean, and consistent throughout.
levels.3: Lines are clear with good shading and control.
levels.2: Line quality is uneven; shading is basic.
levels.1: Line work is weak and shading is minimal.

levels.4: Composition is dynamic and balanced; proportions are accurate.
levels.3: Composition is clear with mostly correct proportions.
levels.2: Composition is cluttered or unbalanced; proportions are inconsistent.
levels.1: Composition is unclear and proportions are incorrect.

levels.4: Scene communicates strong action and mood clearly.
levels.3: Scene communicates action and mood with minor gaps.
levels.2: Scene partially communicates narrative; mood is unclear.
levels.1: Scene lacks narrative and mood.

levels.4: Process shows clear planning, revision, and refinement.
levels.3: Process shows planning with some refinement.
levels.2: Process shows minimal planning and revision.
levels.1: No evidence of planning or process.

quest39.title: Scrolls of the Eastern Guild
quest39.rationale:
Scrolls of the Eastern Guild

Why it’s important:
Studying manga style teaches clean, confident linework and stylized anatomy. This quest builds the foundation for stylized character drawing and visual storytelling.

Skills developed:

  • Manga-style facial proportions
  • Clean and confident line quality
  • Stylized anatomy and design
  • Expressive character gesture
  • Understanding of style rules and variation

This quest strengthens your ability to draw characters in a consistent, stylized way.
quest39.description:
Chloris traveled the entire word and was able to acquire an ancient scrolls from the Eastern Guild, revealing a stylized approach to drawing heroes and legends.
You are tasked with studying this tradition and creating a character using the visual language of Japanese manga.
requirements: Draw a manga-style character
Use pencil or ink
Show stylized facial proportions
Use clean and confident lines
draw the entire body

levels.4: Lines are clean, confident, and consistent throughout the character.
levels.3: Lines are clear with good control.
levels.2: Lines are uneven or hesitant in several areas.
levels.1: Lines are weak and inconsistent.

levels.4: Proportions match manga style with strong stylization.
levels.3: Proportions are mostly correct with recognizable style.
levels.2: Proportions are inconsistent; style is unclear.
levels.1: Proportions are incorrect and style is not evident.

quest41.title: The Master’s Table
quest41.rationale:
The Master’s Table

Why it’s important:
Still life drawing teaches observation, proportion, and value. It builds discipline and improves your ability to represent objects accurately from life.

Skills developed:

  • Accurate proportion and scale
  • Observation of light and shadow
  • Value contrast and gradation
  • Surface texture and material rendering
  • Composition and arrangement

This quest strengthens your ability to render realistic objects and improves your overall drawing accuracy.
quest41.description:
Inside the Poa Castle a Master Sketcher has arranged a set of quiet objects on a table, seeking accurate records before time erodes them.
You are asked to draw this still life using pencil or charcoal, focusing on observation, proportion, and light.
requirements: Draw a still life using pencil or charcoal
Include at least three objects
Show correct proportions
Use shading to show form and light

levels.4: Objects show exceptional shading, texture, and realism.
levels.3: Objects show strong shading and clear form.
levels.2: Shading is basic and forms are partially clear.
levels.1: Shading is minimal; forms are unclear.

levels.4: Proportions are accurate; objects are well-arranged with depth.
levels.3: Proportions are mostly accurate with some depth.
levels.2: Proportions are inconsistent; depth is weak.
levels.1: Proportions are incorrect and depth is missing.

levels.4: Observation is detailed; materials and light are accurately represented.
levels.3: Observation is clear with mostly accurate details.
levels.2: Observation is basic; some details are missing or inaccurate.
levels.1: Observation is weak; details are missing or incorrect.

levels.4: Strong process documentation with clear stages and revisions.
levels.3: Good process documentation with visible steps.
levels.2: Some documentation; process is incomplete.
levels.1: No process documentation provided.

quest42.title: The Vanishing Road
quest42.rationale:
The Vanishing Road

Why it’s important:
One-point perspective teaches depth and spatial organization. It is essential for drawing scenes that recede into space with correct structure.

Skills developed:

  • Understanding horizon line and vanishing point
  • Creating depth with receding objects
  • Accurate spatial construction
  • Proportion and scale in perspective
  • Line control and consistency

This quest builds a foundation for architectural drawing and realistic environments.
quest42.description:
The old scholar stares at the horizon, where everything disappear into a single vanishing point, maping the environment. He sees you and asks for your help and denying is impossible...
You are tasked with learning the rules of one-point perspective to guide travelers safely through space.
requirements: Create a drawing using one-point perspective
Include a clear horizon line
Use one vanishing point
Draw objects receding into space

levels.4: Perspective is precise with strong depth and consistency.
levels.3: Perspective is clear with minor inconsistencies.
levels.2: Perspective is somewhat correct but has noticeable errors.
levels.1: Perspective is incorrect or unclear.

levels.4: Composition shows excellent depth and space organization.
levels.3: Composition shows good depth with minor issues.
levels.2: Composition has weak depth and unclear spatial structure.
levels.1: Composition lacks depth and spatial clarity.

quest43.title: The Corner of the City
quest43.rationale:
The Corner of the City

Why it’s important:
Two-point perspective introduces multiple vanishing points and realistic architectural structure. This quest teaches how to build believable environments.

Skills developed:

  • Two-point perspective construction
  • Accurate building proportions
  • Spatial depth and structure
  • Consistent vanishing points
  • Architectural line precision

This quest strengthens your ability to draw urban scenes with correct perspective and structure.
quest43.description:
At the intersection of two streets Mohamed poses for a photo while buildings rise on either side. You watch a magician create an image of the buildings. In awe you decide to try the same.
You must map this space using two-point perspective, revealing depth and structure through careful construction.
requirements: Create a drawing using two-point perspective
Use two vanishing points
Include architectural forms
Maintain consistent proportions

levels.4: Two-point perspective is accurate and consistent throughout.
levels.3: Perspective is mostly correct with minor errors.
levels.2: Perspective has noticeable errors in vanishing points.
levels.1: Perspective is incorrect or inconsistent.

levels.4: Buildings are well-proportioned with strong structural clarity.
levels.3: Buildings are proportionate with minor structural issues.
levels.2: Buildings are uneven in proportion or structure.
levels.1: Buildings lack proportion and structure.

quest44.title: The Tower Above
quest44.rationale:
The Tower Above

Why it’s important:
Three-point perspective teaches dramatic height and depth, adding realism to towering structures. It challenges your understanding of space from extreme angles.

Skills developed:

  • Three-point perspective construction
  • Accurate height and depth proportions
  • Dramatic foreshortening
  • Consistent perspective lines
  • Spatial coherence in extreme viewpoints

This quest strengthens your ability to depict dramatic architectural scenes.
quest44.description:
Across the street you can see a vending machine on the 10th floor of a building. You stand at the base of the towering structure, looking up as it stretches into the sky.
To capture this view, you must master three-point perspective.
requirements: Create a drawing using three-point perspective
Use three vanishing points
Show dramatic height or depth
Keep perspective lines consistent

levels.4: Three-point perspective is accurate with strong depth and drama.
levels.3: Perspective is clear with minor errors.
levels.2: Perspective is partially correct but inconsistent.
levels.1: Perspective is incorrect or unclear.

levels.4: Structure is strong and proportions are accurate in dramatic angle.
levels.3: Structure is solid with minor proportion issues.
levels.2: Structure is weak and proportions are inconsistent.
levels.1: Structure is unclear and proportions are incorrect.

quest45.title: The Watcher’s Eye
quest45.rationale:
The Watcher’s Eye

Why it’s important:
Four-point perspective bends reality into a wide, immersive field of view. It teaches how to maintain structure while distorting space.

Skills developed:

  • Curved perspective line control
  • Maintaining spatial consistency
  • Drawing extreme depth and distortion
  • Composing a wide field of view
  • Understanding complex spatial relationships

This quest develops advanced perspective skills and helps you draw immersive, dynamic environments.
quest45.description:
From the skies, Niff - the great observer sees the world curve around her.
You can only guess how the wold looks from that far above and decide to represent space using four-point perspective, bending reality while maintaining structure.
requirements: Create a drawing using four-point perspective
Use curved perspective lines
Show extreme depth or distortion
Maintain spatial consistency

levels.4: Curved perspective is highly controlled and consistent.
levels.3: Curved perspective is clear with minor errors.
levels.2: Curved perspective is inconsistent or unclear.
levels.1: Curved perspective is incorrect or missing.

levels.4: Spatial relationships are coherent and realistic despite distortion.
levels.3: Spatial relationships are mostly coherent.
levels.2: Spatial relationships are inconsistent in multiple areas.
levels.1: Spatial relationships are unclear or incorrect.

quest46.title: The World Unbound
quest46.rationale:
The World Unbound

Why it’s important:
Five-point perspective represents a full spherical view. This quest challenges your understanding of space, composition, and structure at the highest level.

Skills developed:

  • Five-point perspective construction
  • Wide-angle composition
  • Maintaining believable spatial flow
  • Complex line and curve control
  • Advanced environment mapping

This quest develops the ability to draw a complete world in motion with strong spatial logic.
quest46.description:
The 'Aranha de Cristal' sees everything. Space bends fully around her, enclosing the entire scene.
To defeat her, you must understand how she sees the world. You must attempt a five-point perspective drawing, capturing a world in motion.
requirements: Create a drawing using five-point perspective
Use five vanishing points
Show a wide field of view
Maintain believable spatial flow

levels.4: Five-point perspective is accurate and consistent throughout.
levels.3: Perspective is mostly accurate with minor inconsistencies.
levels.2: Perspective is partially correct but inconsistent.
levels.1: Perspective is incorrect or missing.

levels.4: Spatial flow is believable and cohesive across the scene.
levels.3: Spatial flow is mostly coherent.
levels.2: Spatial flow is inconsistent or confusing.
levels.1: Spatial flow is unclear or not believable.

quest47.title: The Warrior’s Reach
quest47.rationale:
The Warrior’s Reach

Why it’s important:
Foreshortening creates the illusion of depth by compressing forms in space. This quest teaches you to visualize and draw objects projecting toward the viewer.

Skills developed:

  • Foreshortened anatomy and proportion
  • Depth illusion through overlapping forms
  • Correct scale and perspective
  • Shading to support form and depth
  • Dynamic gesture and action

This quest strengthens your ability to draw powerful, immersive figures in motion.
quest47.description:
A warrior lunges forward, their weapon thrust toward the viewer.
To capture this moment, you must study foreshortening and the illusion of depth.
requirements: Create a drawing that uses foreshortening
Show strong depth illusion
Maintain believable proportions
Use shading to support form

levels.4: Foreshortening is convincing and highly accurate.
levels.3: Foreshortening is clear with minor issues.
levels.2: Foreshortening is inconsistent or partially incorrect.
levels.1: Foreshortening is incorrect or not evident.

levels.4: Depth is strong and proportions are accurate throughout.
levels.3: Depth is clear with mostly correct proportions.
levels.2: Depth is weak and proportions are inconsistent.
levels.1: Depth is unclear and proportions are incorrect.

quest48.title: The Geometry of Truth
quest48.rationale:
The Geometry of Truth

Why it’s important:
Basic geometric forms teach volume, light, and shadow. This quest is essential for building strong foundations in rendering and 3D thinking.

Skills developed:

  • Drawing cubes, spheres, cylinders, cones
  • Shading for volume and depth
  • Light source and shadow placement
  • Clean edge control and form clarity
  • Understanding 3D structure in drawing

This quest builds the core skills needed for realistic rendering and complex figure drawing.
quest48.description:
Before mastering the complex, you must understand the simple.
The professor wants you to show your understanding of volume and asks you to draw basic geometric forms, revealing volume through light and shadow.
requirements: Draw basic geometric shapes in pencil or charcoal
Include at least three different forms
Use shading to show volume
Keep edges clean and controlled

levels.4: Forms appear fully 3D with strong shading and clear volume.
levels.3: Forms show good volume with clear shading.
levels.2: Forms show partial volume with inconsistent shading.
levels.1: Forms appear flat with little to no shading.

levels.4: Shapes are accurate with clean edges and strong structure.
levels.3: Shapes are mostly accurate with good edges.
levels.2: Shapes are uneven with weak edge control.
levels.1: Shapes are incorrect and edges are unclear.

quest53.title: The face stealer
quest53.rationale:
The Face Stealer

Why it’s important:
This quest teaches facial anatomy in 3D. Sculpting a face strengthens your understanding of proportions, planes, and expression—skills that directly improve both sculpture and drawing.

Skills developed:

  • Facial proportion and symmetry
  • Understanding of facial planes and volume
  • Texturing skin, hair, and features
  • Building expression through shape and depth
  • Fine motor control with clay tools

This quest builds a strong foundation in three-dimensional portraiture and expressive sculpture.
quest53.description:
Deep within the mountains a monster lives: Noppera-bō, the Faceless. The elders believe it was once a protector, but the loss of its face change it, now he wears the looks of anyone that cross its path. The dewarves of Etrihilleim decided its face and are looking for a courageous adventurer to craft a final face for it.
If you undertake this role you are tasked with sculpting a face using air-dry clay. Your goal is to capture expression, proportion, and surface detail. The mask should feel alive, as if it could speak.
requirements: Create a face sculpture using air-dry clay
Show correct facial proportions
Include details like eyes, nose, mouth, and ears
Add a exaggerated expression to it
Use texture and surface detail

levels.4: Face proportions are highly accurate and realistic with strong anatomy.
levels.3: Face proportions are mostly accurate with minor inconsistencies.
levels.2: Some proportional errors affect realism.
levels.1: Proportions are inaccurate and undermine the face structure.

levels.4: Highly refined details (eyes, nose, mouth, ears) with excellent surface control.
levels.3: Good detail and surface quality with minor imperfections.
levels.2: Some details are unclear or poorly defined.
levels.1: Minimal detail; surface looks unfinished.

levels.4: Expression is clear and strongly communicates emotion.
levels.3: Expression is visible and generally clear.
levels.2: Expression is weak or inconsistent.
levels.1: Expression is unclear or missing.

levels.4: Clear process documentation with strong reflection and improvement steps.
levels.3: Good documentation showing progress and decisions.
levels.2: Some documentation but lacks clarity or reflection.
levels.1: Little or no process documentation.

quest54.title: The Necklace of the Desert Moon
quest54.rationale:
The Necklace of the Desert Moon

Why it’s important:
This quest focuses on precision, pattern, and cultural design. Jewelry sculpture trains your ability to work in small scale while maintaining symmetry and detail.

Skills developed:

  • Symmetry and balance in design
  • Small-scale detailing and texture
  • Pattern repetition and rhythm
  • Planning a design through sketching
  • Control of fine hand movements and clay consistency

This quest improves your precision and patience, essential for any detailed sculpting work.
quest54.description:
The Navajo people of the desert are known for their silver and turquoise jewelry, believed to carry protective power. It's beauty call for you and you decided to join then in creating their old technique.
You are asked to create a traditional jewelry sculpture using air-dry clay, inspired by Navajo designs. Your piece should reflect symmetry, pattern, and cultural respect.
requirements: Create a jewelry sculpture inspired by Navajo turquoise silver necklaces
Start with a sketch of the design. It should be in colours and seem from different angles.
Use air-dry clay
Include repeating patterns and symmetry
Use texture to simulate metal and stones

rubric.overall: The Necklace of the Desert Moon

levels.4: Exceptional precision with clean, detailed small-scale work.
levels.3: Good precision with clear detail.
levels.2: Some precision issues affecting clarity.
levels.1: Poor precision with unclear details.

levels.4: Strong symmetry and repeating patterns are very consistent.
levels.3: Symmetry and pattern are mostly consistent.
levels.2: Some symmetry or pattern issues.
levels.1: Patterns are inconsistent or missing.

levels.4: Sketches show strong planning and clear cultural research.
levels.3: Sketches show planning and some cultural understanding.
levels.2: Sketches are basic and lack planning.
levels.1: No planning or sketch evidence.

quest56.title: The Story Tile of the Hearth
quest56.rationale:
The Story Tile of the Hearth

Why it’s important:
Low-relief sculpture teaches composition and depth in a constrained space. This quest builds storytelling through form and encourages thoughtful visual narrative.

Skills developed:

  • Relief depth and layering
  • Composition and visual storytelling
  • Texture for surface interest
  • Planning and sketching before sculpting
  • Creating clear foreground and background

This quest strengthens your ability to communicate stories through sculpture and develop visual hierarchy.
quest56.description:
A village elder has asked you to create a tile that tells a story of your life or culture. The tile will be used to decorate the community hall.
You must create a low-relief sculpture using air-dry clay, focusing on composition, depth, and texture. The scene should be clear and meaningful.
requirements: Create a triptych relief tile using air-dry clay
Start with a sketch of the design.
Include a clear scene or story
Use depth to show foreground and background
Add texture for visual interest

rubric.overall: The Story Tile of the Hearth

levels.4: Depth is strong with clear foreground/background separation.
levels.3: Depth is clear with some layering.
levels.2: Depth is inconsistent or weak.
levels.1: Depth is not clear or missing.

levels.4: Story is very clear and composition is balanced.
levels.3: Story is clear with good composition.
levels.2: Story is somewhat unclear; composition is uneven.
levels.1: Story is unclear and composition is weak.

levels.4: Sketches show strong planning and clear story development.
levels.3: Sketches show planning and some story clarity.
levels.2: Sketches are basic and incomplete.
levels.1: No planning or sketch evidence.

quest57.title: The Bound Spirit
quest57.rationale:
The Bound Spirit

Why it’s important:
Wire sculpture emphasizes line, movement, and structural balance. It teaches you to build forms with minimal materials while expressing motion and emotion.

Skills developed:

  • Understanding line as structure
  • Creating dynamic movement and gesture
  • Three-dimensional composition
  • Strength and stability in construction
  • Working with tools to bend and secure wire

This quest develops your ability to build expressive forms with strong structural integrity.
quest57.description:
A trapped spirit is said to wander the realm, bound by invisible lines. To free it, you must create a wire sculpture that captures motion and emotion using only line and form.
You will bend and twist wire into a three-dimensional figure that expresses energy and movement, as if it could come to life.
requirements: Create a wire sculpture using wire and tools
it might be done in groups of two, depending on the size of the sculpture and complexity
Express motion or emotion through line
Include a stable base or structure
Use varied thickness and direction for visual interest

levels.4: Wire construction is very clean, stable, and skillful.
levels.3: Wire construction is solid with minor issues.
levels.2: Construction is weak or unstable.
levels.1: Construction is unstable and poorly built.

levels.4: Motion and gesture are strong and clearly readable.
levels.3: Motion is clear with some visual interest.
levels.2: Motion is weak or inconsistent.
levels.1: Motion is not visible or unclear.

levels.4: Structure is very stable with strong base support.
levels.3: Structure is stable with minor balance issues.
levels.2: Structure is somewhat unstable.
levels.1: Structure is unstable and falls apart.

levels.4: Process shows strong planning, tools, and steps.
levels.3: Process is documented with some detail.
levels.2: Process is incomplete or unclear.
levels.1: No process documentation.

quest58.title: The Citadel of Forms
quest58.rationale:
The Citadel of Forms

Why it’s important:
This quest teaches architectural thinking in 3D. Creating buildings strengthens your understanding of mass, balance, and structural design.

Skills developed:

  • Understanding mass and volume
  • Structural design and stability
  • Architectural detail and proportion
  • Spatial planning and balance
  • Mixed media integration for strong form

This quest builds a foundation for architectural sculpture and design-focused 3D art.
quest58.description:
The ancient city of Lomakkeiden Kaupunki is built from pure geometric harmony: its arches mimicing nature; it's skyscrapers - marvels of modern craftsmanship. Inspired, you take the role of archtect and design your own building, focusing on strong structure and design.
You may also choose an abstract architectural form, but it must still show clear understanding of mass, balance, and space.
requirements: Create a building or house sculpture using mixed media
Show clear structure and architectural form
Include details such as windows, doors, or roof elements
Optional: create an abstract architectural form focusing on shapes

levels.4: Strong mass and volume with excellent 3D form clarity.
levels.3: Good mass and volume with minor issues.
levels.2: Some mass issues affect form clarity.
levels.1: Mass and volume are unclear or weak.

levels.4: Structure is very stable and well-engineered.
levels.3: Structure is stable with minor flaws.
levels.2: Structure is unstable in some areas.
levels.1: Structure is unstable and poorly designed.

levels.4: Details are precise and proportional with strong design choices.
levels.3: Details are clear and proportional.
levels.2: Details are inconsistent or disproportionate.
levels.1: Details are unclear or missing.

levels.4: Process shows strong planning, design sketches, and thoughtful revisions.
levels.3: Process shows planning and design choices.
levels.2: Process is limited or lacks clarity.
levels.1: No process evidence.

quest59.title: The Scales of Balance
quest59.rationale:
The Scales of Balance

Why it’s important:
Balance is one of the core principles of sculpture. This quest trains you to design stable forms while maintaining visual harmony.

Skills developed:

  • Understanding physical stability and center of gravity
  • Symmetry and intentional asymmetry
  • Weight distribution and structural integrity
  • Visual balance through composition
  • Mixed media integration for support and style

This quest strengthens your ability to create sculptures that are both beautiful and structurally sound.
quest59.description:
The Temple of Equilibrium calls for a sculpture that physically represents balance. You must design a piece that feels stable and visually balanced, whether symmetrical or asymmetrical.
The sculpture should show clear control of weight and distribution, proving your mastery of this principle.
requirements: Create a sculpture that demonstrates balance
Use mixed media
Show symmetry or intentional asymmetry
Ensure the piece is stable and not top-heavy

levels.4: Sculpture is extremely stable with strong weight distribution.
levels.3: Sculpture is stable with minor balance issues.
levels.2: Sculpture is somewhat unstable or top-heavy.
levels.1: Sculpture is unstable and unsafe.

levels.4: Visual balance is strong and intentional, with excellent composition.
levels.3: Visual balance is clear with good composition.
levels.2: Visual balance is weak or inconsistent.
levels.1: Visual balance is unclear or lacking.

levels.4: Strong planning and documentation showing design decisions.
levels.3: Good planning and process evidence.
levels.2: Limited planning or unclear process.
levels.1: No process evidence.

quest60.title: The Duel of Light and Shadow
quest60.rationale:
The Duel of Light and Shadow

Why it’s important:
Contrast creates drama in sculpture. This quest teaches how to use texture, thickness, and shape to emphasize opposing elements.

Skills developed:

  • Textural contrast (smooth vs rough)
  • Form contrast (thick vs thin)
  • Visual impact through opposing elements
  • Creative use of material differences
  • Understanding how light interacts with surface

This quest improves your ability to design sculptures with strong visual tension and clarity.
quest60.description:
A wizard of shadows challenges you to create a sculpture that shows strong contrast between smooth and rough, thick and thin, light and dark.
Your work should clearly display opposing elements, making the difference visible and powerful.
requirements: Create a sculpture demonstrating contrast
Use different textures and shapes
Include a mix of thick and thin elements
Make contrasts clearly visible

rubric.overall: The Duel of Light and Shadow

levels.4: Contrast is dramatic and intentional with strong texture variety.
levels.3: Contrast is clear with good texture variety.
levels.2: Contrast is weak or inconsistent.
levels.1: Little to no contrast visible.

levels.4: Contrast creates strong visual drama and clarity.
levels.3: Contrast creates good visual impact.
levels.2: Contrast is unclear or weak.
levels.1: No visual impact.

levels.4: Process shows intentional contrast decisions and planning.
levels.3: Process shows planning with some clarity.
levels.2: Process is limited or unclear.
levels.1: No process evidence.

quest61.title: The Heart of the Statue
quest61.rationale:
The Heart of the Statue

Why it’s important:
Creating a clear focal point teaches visual hierarchy and intentional design. This quest trains you to guide the viewer’s eye and emphasize meaning through sculpture.

Skills developed:

  • Creating emphasis through size, texture, or detail
  • Designing visual hierarchy
  • Balancing supporting forms
  • Planning composition for impact
  • Clarity of storytelling through focal points

This quest strengthens your ability to design sculptures with strong emotional and visual focus.
quest61.description:
The Shrine of Focus demands a sculpture with a clear focal point. Your challenge is to create a piece where one area draws the viewer’s attention first.
Use shape, size, texture, or detail to create emphasis and guide the eye.
requirements: Create a sculpture with clear emphasis
Use one strong focal point
Use size, texture, or detail to emphasize
Support the focal point with surrounding forms

levels.4: Focal point is very strong and immediately draws attention.
levels.3: Focal point is clear and effective.
levels.2: Focal point is weak or unclear.
levels.1: No clear focal point.

levels.4: Supporting elements enhance the focal point perfectly.
levels.3: Supporting elements generally support the focal point.
levels.2: Supporting elements are inconsistent.
levels.1: Supporting elements distract from focal point.

levels.4: Planning shows strong intention and clear visual hierarchy.
levels.3: Planning shows good intention.
levels.2: Planning is minimal or unclear.
levels.1: No planning evidence.

quest62.title: The Dance of the Wind
quest62.rationale:
The Dance of the Wind

Why it’s important:
Movement in sculpture brings life and energy. This quest teaches you how to suggest motion through shape, line, and rhythm in 3D.

Skills developed:

  • Dynamic composition and flow
  • Gesture and rhythm in form
  • Working with curves and directional lines
  • Balance and stability in dynamic shapes
  • Creating movement that reads from multiple angles

This quest builds your ability to create sculptures that feel alive and fluid.
quest62.description:
A wind spirit wants to be seen in solid form. You must create a sculpture that suggests movement—flowing lines, twisting shapes, or dynamic poses.
The piece should feel alive, as if it could shift with the breeze.
requirements: Create a sculpture that suggests movement
Use flowing lines or dynamic shapes
Show direction and rhythm
Make the movement clear from different angles

levels.4: Movement is strong and fluid from all angles.
levels.3: Movement is clear and readable.
levels.2: Movement is weak or inconsistent.
levels.1: Movement is unclear or absent.

levels.4: Forms show strong rhythm and dynamic composition.
levels.3: Forms show good rhythm.
levels.2: Rhythm is inconsistent.
levels.1: Rhythm is absent.

levels.4: Process shows clear planning and movement decisions.
levels.3: Process shows planning with some clarity.
levels.2: Process is limited or unclear.
levels.1: No process evidence.

quest63.title: The Echoing Repetition
quest63.rationale:
The Echoing Repetition

Why it’s important:
Repetition creates rhythm and harmony in sculpture. This quest teaches pattern, structure, and consistency while building visual movement.

Skills developed:

  • Pattern creation and repetition
  • Visual rhythm and flow
  • Consistency in repeated forms
  • Balancing repetition with variety
  • Creating sculptural unity through repeated elements

This quest strengthens your ability to create cohesive sculptures with strong visual rhythm.
quest63.description:
A bard of stone wants to hear rhythm through form. You must create a sculpture that uses repetition and pattern to create visual rhythm.
The piece should feel like a repeated beat or pulse, guiding the viewer through its shapes.
requirements: Create a sculpture showing rhythm
Use repeated shapes or patterns
Create a sense of movement through repetition
Maintain visual consistency

levels.4: Patterns are very consistent and rhythm is strong.
levels.3: Patterns are clear and consistent.
levels.2: Patterns are inconsistent or weak.
levels.1: Patterns are missing or unclear.

levels.4: Rhythm is strong and creates unity throughout the sculpture.
levels.3: Rhythm is clear and supports unity.
levels.2: Rhythm is weak or uneven.
levels.1: No rhythm or unity.

levels.4: Process shows intentional planning of pattern and rhythm.
levels.3: Process shows planning with some clarity.
levels.2: Process is limited or unclear.
levels.1: No process evidence.

quest68.title: The Master Forgemaster’s Covenant
quest68.rationale:
The Master Forgemaster’s Covenant

Why it’s important:
This summative team quest challenges artists to collaborate in designing and constructing a cosplay build using EVA foam. By working in small teams, students must communicate ideas, divide responsibilities, and refine a shared vision while demonstrating craftsmanship and technical growth.

Skills developed:

  • Collaborative planning and problem-solving
  • Experimentation with materials and techniques
  • Three-dimensional construction and craftsmanship
  • Revision, refinement, and process documentation
quest68.description:
No great armor is forged alone.
In this final trial, a small guild of artisans must work together to design and construct a cosplay build using EVA foam. Teams of no more than three must coordinate planning, fabrication, and refinement to produce a cohesive final piece.
requirements: Work in a team of no more than three students
Collaboratively design a cosplay build using sketches or patterns
Experiment with EVA foam techniques during construction
Construct a complete and cohesive cosplay element or set
Refine the final work based on testing, feedback, and team reflection
Document the process, including individual contributions

levels.4: Team demonstrates exceptional collaboration with a unified vision and balanced contributions.
levels.3: Team collaborates effectively with clear shared planning.
levels.2: Collaboration is uneven; roles or communication are inconsistent.
levels.1: Minimal collaboration; work appears fragmented.

levels.4: Exceptional craftsmanship and control of EVA foam techniques throughout the build.
levels.3: Effective use of techniques with solid construction.
levels.2: Inconsistent technique application; structural or finish issues present.
levels.1: Limited understanding of EVA foam techniques.

levels.4: Extensive refinement and revisions significantly improve the final build.
levels.3: Clear refinement and revisions enhance the cosplay piece.
levels.2: Some refinement; revisions are limited.
levels.1: Little evidence of refinement or revision.

levels.4: Thorough documentation clearly shows development, decisions, and individual roles.
levels.3: Documentation shows key stages and contributions.
levels.2: Limited documentation with unclear roles or missing stages.
levels.1: Minimal or no documentation provided.
